page.title: 03BISHOP BURTON YTS &'CROFT'
page.content: The College of Agriculture operates a {Youth Training Scheme (YTS)}offering broad-based training in life skills with specific emphasis on agriculture or horticulture or related subjects. There are 230 trainees, many of whom go on to full-time courses at the College. The YTS programme has meant increased resources and staff being available to the College but has meant a move away from County to national financing. Newly redeveloped in 1985, {The Croft}is a rural skills unit for children with special needs. It also acts as a teaching centre for visiting school parties. About 75 handicapped people attend the unit each week which is run by 3 full-time staff and has cows, calves, ponies, ducks, goats and chickens. Several hundred children visit the college per week and 2000 children come to a{Schools Open Day.
